arts.ttl: Relief for Zetterer, Weiser apologetic after stunning win in Leverkusen
arts.sum: Michael Zetterer kept a clean sheet against Bayer Leverkusen after his mistake proved costly last week. Meanwhile, Mitchell Weiser faces criticism for a strong challenge on Florian Wirtz.
Xabi Alonso reflects on an awful day for Bayer Leverkusen as their defeat was followed by injury concerns to key players.

arts.ttl: Werder Bremen stun Bayer Leverkusen with shock 2-0 win
arts.sum: Werder Bremen secure a surprising 2-0 victory against Bayer Leverkusen, with goals from Romano Schmid and Justin Njinmah. Bayer Leverkusen's struggles compounded by Florian Wirtz's injury in a match that could impact the Bundesliga title race.
It was a day to forget for Bayer Leverkusen as they missed out on a chance to close the gap with Bayern … and Florian Wirtz facing an injury concern.

arts.ttl: Report: Xabi Alonso could be Real Madrid boss in summer
arts.sum: Die Werkself's head coach could be tempted into becoming head coach of his former club ahead of the 2025-26 campaign.

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen vs. Werder Bremen preview: Die Werkself looking for response after Bayern defeat
arts.sum: Bayer Leverkusen will look to bounce back from their heavy Champions League defeat to Bayern Munich when they welcome Werder Bremen to the BayArena for Saturday’s Bundesliga fixture.
Bayer Leverkusen coach Xabi Alonso has confirmed that Robert Andrich will miss out again when Die Werkself take on Werder Bremen this weekend.

arts.ttl: Jeremie Frimpong's Bayer Leverkusen meltdown as ex Celtic star roars at teammate to 'f*** off'
arts.sum: Tensions were running high after Leverkusen were smashed 3-0 by rivals Bayern Munich in the first leg of their Champions League last 16 clash on Wednesday

arts.ttl: Dortmund and Leverkusen named as suitors for Czech international
arts.sum: Borussia Dortmund and Bayer Leverkusen are reportedly among the clubs interested in Czech international Pavel Sulc.

arts.ttl: Bayer Leverkusen reeling after loss to Bayern Munich in Champions League
arts.sum: Mostly everyone thought Bayern mUnich and Bayer Leverkusen would be a battle in the Champions League on Wednesday. You can say we’ll need a miracle for the second leg,” said former Bayern Munich midfielder and current Bayer Leverkusen coach Xabi Alonso (as captured by FCBayern.com ).
